Chapter.Title: Chapter 6-Star of the City-‘I try calling each star something beautiful.’

Dialog.Content: The City shimmers and swells with desires as it always has.
Humans must weave their tales in this everlasting status quo.
Today, a Star named ‘The Library’ rose up to the sky. What kinds of dreams shall it illuminate over the City, I wonder…
May the City stay mesmerized in its sweet dream, no matter how brightly this Star may shine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You look busy. What are you up to?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m making a list of things I want to do once everything is over and I get to leave this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s a pretty big list?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I made sure to include trying the meat stew you mentioned some time ago.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So you really remembered, huh.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can remember anything, after all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s the point of making a list, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, no offense to you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …You’re right, actually. I’m writing this down so I don’t forget later.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? That means…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps I really am becoming closer to a human.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can feel my memories fade away, albeit slowly and partially. I’ve never had this happen to me before.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I still have mountains upon mountains of memories left to erase, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, congrats anyway. Your earnest wish is finally coming true.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Thanks. Now I’m writing down a list of things I want to do next. To dream of my “next step”.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s like a fence… like you taught me earlier.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To dream, huh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What about you, Roland? What do you want to do first when you leave here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: For one, I’m thinking about quitting being a Fixer. I’m tired of it overall.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Really? I don’t know what kind of Fixer you used to be, but from what I’ve seen by your side, you seemed quite well suited for the job.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not only are you a skilled combatant, you’re also adept at dealing with a multitude of situations and getting tasks done smoothly. Perhaps you really were a “kickass” as you claim.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To me, those traits seemed to be the qualities that determine a good Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I guess being a Fixer is the one career that fits me best.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But I wanna take a break from it now. I’ve had enough.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve made enough people bleed for causes that aren’t mine…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So, what kind of work do you want to do?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’re being awfully persistent about it…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: After I’m done with business here…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Hngh, I’m drawing a blank.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you’re out of ideas, why don’t you help me?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll hire you officially and properly this time. I could give you proper payment if you insist.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s the job entail?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The things written on this list, of course.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Look, I told you just now that…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t worry, none of these are about harming anyone.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll have had enough of that from running the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Thinking about my next move as you advised, the first thing that came to my mind was freedom.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Once I’ve had my revenge and earned my freedom, I thought it’d be nice to travel around the world without worrying about anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Still, if you’re asking me to escort you throughout your trip…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t be silly. I can defend myself just fine. All you need to do is be my companion to talk with.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Looking at the guests who have visited us thus far, I doubt I’ll ever get to make a friend who can get on with me as well as you do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Friend, huh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Or was I just under an illusion?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have so few acquaintances I’ve known, and my relationship with those few people was nothing pleasant.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Each of us was simply playing the designated roles on a stage.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To them, I was merely a tool and a machine built to recite the script. Nothing more, nothing less.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You mean the librarians… No, the Sephirot and the employees…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If we met in a different place under different circumstances, then we could’ve been… good colleagues, perhaps.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway, what do you think?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hm?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My job offer for when we’re done here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, about that… Yeah, I’ll consider it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That doesn’t sound bad, alright.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Letting go of all woes and just wandering the world.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: The most recent case of the Distortion, ‘The Crying Children’… It’s not quite comparable to ‘The Pianist’, but the damage it’s caused is still rather severe.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Since The Crying Children appeared in V Corp’s Nest, not the Backstreets, multiple Associations are troubled.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director, could you remind us about how many casualties it has caused?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: It amounts to 80,000 as of now.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s still better than the Pianist, which took 300,000 lives in one fell swoop.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Not quite. This is in fact more severe than the Pianist.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: While the Pianist only annihilated the residential area of the Backstreets of District 9, the Crying Children struck the Nest, which makes this case especially critical.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Yeah, the Nest is supposed to be the safest place of all.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Oh, hey there, Xiao… When did you come here?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Section 1 is on high alert, you see. I’m here to ask what Section 2 thinks of this matter.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: C’mon, be honest, Director Xiao.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Cecil!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Hmhmm…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …Anyway, the president of our association must be looking daggers at our backs.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Mei, give a briefing on the information we’ve gathered about the Crying Children so far.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yessir. Philip, the man who is suspected to be the origin of the Crying Children, was a Fixer working at Dawn Office.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dawn Office was a Grade 4 Office located in Nest V.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It was an associate Office affiliated with the Liu, and showed decent performance with a fair lineup.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: That reminds me, isn’t that where Salvador was?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That is correct.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: He used to be a hotshot in his prime, though he’s only a washed up old man now.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Going back to the briefing, the Dawn Office has closed business after all of its Fixers died in the Library.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Except for one: Philip.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Philip was a Grade 5 Fixer. Being the only survivor, Philip paid a visit to Wedge Office, a partner of Dawn Office…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Then the Wedge Office fell victim to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: There’s too little we can deduce from the story so far… Isn’t it too speculative to assume that Philip is the Crying Children?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Actually, there’s some evidence to back this up…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: A Fixer allegedly witnessed a marble statue crying near the Library.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: According to them, the sound of wailing could be heard from afar, so I suspect it spent quite some time crying loudly.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then the statue’s shape began shifting…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …Don’t tell me, it turned into Philip?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Apparently, yes. Although the transformation was imperfect, the eyewitness account had striking similarities to Philip’s appearance as listed in official documents.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: However, the entity’s skin, clothes, and everything… It was all composed of wax, according to what they saw.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …That thing wasn’t human.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Afterwards, “Philip” returned to where the Dawn Office was, and another wail could be heard from that location for quite a while.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Not long after that, it started destroying everything around it, except for the Dawn Office.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t see a single feature that resembles Philip from the reports describing its appearance there, though.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Some cases of the Distortion can change their forms, so perhaps this was one such case.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …This is a tricky one. What do you think, Xiao?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Even though it’s not crystal clear… It is plausible.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I can’t help but suspect the Library. We know nothing about the reason it distorted the way it did…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I guess, yeah.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: V Corp. has hired Liu Association as a whole regarding this matter.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: They requested us to acquire any and everything that appears to be related to the Distortion, or dispose of it if the situation does not allow it.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Many of our workforce will be allocated for tasks regarding the Library for a while.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: The president and branch leaders must’ve lapped up this request since a Wing made it.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Every street in the City’s gonna be in a violent mess for some time.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Where is Section 2 going to begin?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We’re starting out by investigating the Library first, naturally. Of course, that won’t be the only thing we’ll be working on with our manpower.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What about Section 1?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Section 1 will start with eliminating the Crying Children as the president directed.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: It’s the most urgent matter that needs to be taken care of right now.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: You’re taking tough work right from the get-go. I’m sure you won’t have trouble handling it, Xiao. But still, be careful.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re such a lovebird, Director Lowell! There’s quite a few associate Offices to help them out, so it should be fine.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Besides, we’re talking about the Maiden of Iron herself. There’s absolutely nothing to worry about.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is he still keeping the memories he had as a human even after turning into that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There were several Abnormalities that would talk about their own pasts, too. It’s not entirely impossible for it to happen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, fair. The others I’ve seen in here could talk to an extent.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm… Rewatching this scene doesn’t feel any better.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I didn’t expect him to break down so badly. Thought he did an okay job overcoming his flaws.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe he could’ve succeeded.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: However, no matter how capable you may be, you will still fall if you don’t hold on to your way with an upright mindset.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He should’ve been especially extra cautious not to succumb to the unstable side he always had.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …That’s how it is, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To think we’ve got the Liu Association coming to the Library…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What kind of association is it?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s a combat-oriented Association specializing in all-out war. Basically the polar opposite of the Shi we received the other day.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: While the Library’s reception structure acted as a strategic advantage against the Shi Association, it’s an ideal stage for the Liu.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You mean each Association employs different strategies depending on its areas of expertise and atmosphere?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. Just take the two Associations we talked about for example, they’re complete opposites.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I could get a glimpse of that from the Association’s atmosphere. Hm, I wonder if the people who appeared to hold rather high positions will come to the Library in the future…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Beats me. If they do, though, it’ll be a huge pain in the ass for sure…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I see. There’s not much I can do to help alleviate that, so good luck taking the trouble.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’ve been receiving reports recently that cases of the Distortion are growing exponentially, centered around Nest L.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Even private Offices are reluctant to take the work, going so far as to cancel contracts one-sidedly.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Not only would they shun requests about dealing with Distortions, they’d also avoid any task related to the Library as well…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …I guess it was to be expected. There’s a reason the Liu was put in charge.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director. I heard that Section 1 has sent us a report about the Distortion.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Yeah. That’s why I called you here.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: You both know how we’re encouraged to take records of the Distortion in order to gather data, right?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes. And our records can only be shown to those in close proximity to a moonlight stone, product of M Corp’s Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Which we’re obliged to carry for our mission, so it doesn’t matter much to us.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What they sent is no ordinary report, is it? If you’re sharing it with us…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: You got that right. There’s something that irked me about the footage that came with it.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Long story short, the Liu’s South Section 1 has failed to capture the Crying Children.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Was the team wiped out?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: No… They just missed it.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: But if Section 1, led by Director Xiao of all people too, couldn’t capture it… This can’t be an average Urban Nightmare.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Has it been exalted recently?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We’ll watch the footage first. It starts around here.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Somewhere in V Corp’s Nest

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Stay sharp, people! We never back down no matter what happens.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixers
Dialog.Content: Yes, ma’am!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director! The Crying Children just fell to the ground.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: It won’t be flying anymore with that messed up body… We’re almost there. This is the final push, so give it your all!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: D—Director… There’s someone…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: What?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Aw, you poor thing… Section 1 of the Liu is out for your blood, a little kid.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Isn’t it sad that no one recognizes the pure and clean melody flowing within you…?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …The Blue Reverberation.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hi there~ Been a while, huh?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Your greeting is as sharp and bitey as I remember.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t know what you’re up to this time… But I’d be glad if you could gently retreat and stay out of this.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’m only here to take that pitiful friend rejected by everyone, that’s all.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Injured, abandoned… And about to be struck down by the likes of you.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: How sad… All he wanted to do was cry. I would shed tears for him, almost.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Cut the nonsense. What more could you possibly want to justify doing this?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I doubt a Fixer at your standing would feel that anything is insufficient…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t think being a Color will save you. If you keep snooping around pulling nonsense like this, your elimination will be in order one day.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: To feel that nothing is insufficient… Eliminated…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Tell me, are you satisfied with your current life?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Affluence on the surface isn’t all there is to it.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: A corner of my heart is always empty. When I try to fill it with useless things, it only gets bigger, and strangles me…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Yes. I’m looking for something, a something that has to fit in that void.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I think I found it… But I’ve yet to claim it.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I can’t wait for the day I fill that emptiness and make myself whole.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: …Oh, is yours filled already? Filled by a person dear to you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …Don’t yap your mouth any further.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Haha, I can’t dare to crack a joke under your fierce gaze…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’d hate to see each other’s insides today, so could you kindly put this scary fellow away?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Just one last question…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: What in the Wings’ name are you planning to do with a monster like that?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: That’s a funny question…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: When there’s a pitiful thing on the street, everyone gets the urge to bring it home and adore it, no…?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I think this one could join me… He looks like an interesting specimen, too.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Don’t you agree, Oswald?

Dialog.Title: The 8 o’Clock Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: He smells too sour right now, but… In our hands, he’ll be letting off a dirty stench in no time!

Dialog.Title: The 8 o’Clock Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: This weird sourness is what you get if you don’t know how to wash a body right.

Dialog.Title: The 8 o’Clock Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I was juuuuust about to neaten him nicely, but Mr. Funnybones over there had to send him elsewhere!!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …What even?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The bottom line is, us taking him shouldn’t bother you at all.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: If I took him, he’d stop destroying this Nest any further. In other words, I’m saving you the fundamental trouble of taking care of him.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: No, that’s all the more reason to stop you. For us, capturing the Distortion is an option.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Creatures are everywhere in the City, does it have to be this poor friend?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’m starting to get tired of talking… So let’s wrap up our friendly conversation here.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Oswald? Give them a show for me.

Dialog.Title: The 8 o’Clock Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Ms. Mermaid, Mr. Knife! It’s time to show the skills we’ve honed and whet!

Dialog.Title: The 8 o’Clock Circus
Dialog.Content: This place will be filled with thunderous cheers and wondrous applause~!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dammit… Director, give us an order!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Blue Reverberation…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The three of us can go to a quiet place for some private talk… Pluto?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: But of course.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …The Blue Reverberation.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t get it. Why would a Fixer at such a high grade do something like that…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: That’s beyond anyone’s understanding for now. Only the Blue Reverberation himself knows.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway, even though the team had no problem handling the troupers of the 8 o’Clock Circus… The Blue Reverberation vanished with the Crying Children in the meantime.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Section 1 will be staying at the temporary base for a few more days to secure samples of other Distortions.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: So that’s why they hadn’t come back by this morning… I was wondering if anything happened to them.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You must be worried a lot, director.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Not at all. I trust in Xiao.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Setting that aside… How’s our situation?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Section 2 isn’t exactly doing much better.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The staff we dispatched to Nest L have reported several casualties, including a sizable number of associate Offices…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: If we continue… We might be in serious trouble.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Yeah… We can’t just sit here and take the losses forever.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We did make some progress, though.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We’ve found that every person who was subject to the Distortion Phenomenon was under extreme emotional stress.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Emotional… stress, sir?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: It seems evident that those who manifested the Distortion were emotionally pressured to an extreme.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: But the thing is, who in the City doesn’t get stressed in their life, really? Everyone’s holding their anguish within themselves.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Exactly. This is my speculation, but it might be that the Distortion occurs when the emotions bottling up inside exceed a certain threshold.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: What that threshold may be, or how high it may be… is still a mystery, though.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: If your hypothesis is sound, the only ways to stop the Distortion altogether would be to reduce people’s stress or heighten each person’s threshold…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Neither of which is possible in the City.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: There still isn’t enough evidence to prove it. We need more info…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Well… It’s our job as Fixers to fix the problems we’re paid to solve. We’ve got to see what else can be done.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I have high expectations for this invitation. Let’s buck up a little.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixers
Dialog.Content: Understood.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: By the way, director, how’s that one thing going?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Hm? Oh, are you talking about me entering the dumpling making contest…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: No, wait… I never told anyone but Xiao about that…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: No! I mean the preparation for your first wedding anniversary next month.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I heard you’re gonna give her a Nest migration permit as a present.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: What? How did you…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Hm hmm.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …Words spread so quickly.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Come on, director. Everyone in Section 2’s gossiping about how you’re spending your newlywed life with Director Xiao the Maiden of Iron.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Let’s save that for after we’ve finished our work.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes, sir!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: And Cecil, we should have a little chat later…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes, sir…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m still unsure what the Blue Reverberation’s goal is, but I think I get one thing for certain.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That he’s an absolute nutcase?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not in the mood for jokes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: From what we’ve seen so far, the Blue Reverberation was gathering Distortions.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No, I’m not sure if they can be called as such. “Distortions” that are capable of thinking and acting rationally…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sure, that’s what he seems to be doing, but…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We still don’t have a clue why. What’s a bunch of freaks going to do?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Whatever it may be, I don’t think it will be a good thing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In any case, we’re wasting our time by pondering over a question we’ll never figure out the answer to on our own.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well… That’s a good point.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So, I suppose it’s common for Fixers to start families?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, it is. They’re often in life-or-death situations together, working face to face.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Most end in tragedy, though. If a couple’s staying in the Fixer business, it won’t take long until only one of them remains.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Exhibit A: Me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Good point. That Fixer is about to meet his end here, too…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …You’re speaking way too casually about it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Roland, I’ll say this before you get sentimental.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They could very well make the choice to not come to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yet they still choose to come here out of their own volition.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Urban Nightmares and beyond are no longer a matter of choice.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Urban Nightmares and Stars of the City are designated as such because there’s an invisible sense of compulsion involved.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Invisible compulsion? That doesn’t change the fact that they’re able to make choices.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If they have things they cherish so much, why should they risk their lives by going to a dangerous place?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They have the liberty of choice.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Angela, you were right when you said no one is truly free in this City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Choice and liberty… The things they cherish so much?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People’s desires clash and intertwine with one another to create an intangible chain. That’s life in the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Them coming here as the Association ordered…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All the guests ending up as books in the Library…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Me leaving the house for urgent work…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They might seem like choices made out of free will, but in truth, our hands were forced by the shackles of others’ desires.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Sigh.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So? Are you saying that I shouldn’t pursue my freedom because I must show consideration for them?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Because I’m a machine? Because I’m unworthy?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No, it’s got nothing to do with those.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But if you keep trying to earn freedom this way, the karma will come back to strangle you one day.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Enough of that drivel. This is this, and that is that.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And we’re here!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: This place looks a lot more antiquated than I expected.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: It does for sure.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you gonna decorate your house in this style, director?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Well, Xiao prefers something cute—

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …Mei! Stop asking silly things and focus on work.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Oh, so that’s our Section 1 Director’s taste, I see… I’ll take note of that.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We are the Fixers of Section 2 of the Liu Association, Southern Branch.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We’ve come to retrieve the books listed on your invitation.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You may take them if you can overcome the ordeals.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Do you have anything else to say? The situation is pressing, and a quick guidance would be appreciated.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Are the books truly worth risking your life over, however?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: What do you mean?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m asking if they’re valuable enough for you to give up the joys of everyday life.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: A machine that’s curious about the life of humans, huh~

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: This is what I must do to protect the joys of life you just mentioned.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: There aren’t a lot of things that are done out of one’s own volition. And we can’t exactly afford to skip on work we don’t feel like doing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So you were… coerced into making this choice.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: May we enter now?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You may. And may you find your book… in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep… This is how it was bound to end, I guess.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m not sure I understand.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The things people must do in order to secure the joys of ordinary life, people’s mindset when they do such work…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The reason your attitude has suddenly changed, when you had no problem laughing off the deaths of numerous other people in the City who were no different from them…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And most of all, the reason I… can’t understand all this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s nothing I can do about the misfortune of others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I just learned to lightly brush off the tragedies I can’t do anything to help with. Laughing things off is the only way to stay sane in this City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I still can’t help but laugh a bitter laugh about matters I should take responsibility for, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Well, I suppose dwelling on a problem without a conclusion would be considered strangling yourself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ll admit, I got too emotional this time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I never meant to say you’re unworthy to gain freedom or anything, Angela.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I know. Both you and I are bearing many wounds.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …My words were too harsh, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, we cool~ Let’s just let it slide. Fighting each other won’t do us any good.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Thumb Southern Base - Meeting Room

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Thank you for participating in the Thumb summit, everyone.
Yes, underboss.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: It’s good to see our families gathered up in one place. Let’s see…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: We have nineteen seats filled. That means all but one family have attended.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: That’s Rumanos Cartel. They’re still in the process of reorganizing structure after being attacked by the Black Silence a while ago.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Still recovering, I see… Thanks for the report.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Cut those friends off. We don’t need a toothless mutt that can’t rearm itself with that much time.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Understood.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Today’s issue is simple.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Take your hands off L Corp’s Nest and the Library. The Thumb will be in direct command of the matter from now on.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: I’d like to give a word of appreciation for the families that have shown much effort. And…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Bullshit! You have no idea how many of our members died for that!

Dialog.Title: Ramier Family
Dialog.Content: Our family already poured a tremendous sum of money into this!

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Who gave you the right to speak up?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: You gotta stay quiet when an elder is talking, pals. You know better than that.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: When a subordinate dares to speak without their superior’s permission, take their lower jaw… Remember the rules.

Dialog.Title: Ramier Family
Dialog.Content: I apologize on behalf of my underling.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Please forgive the rudeness of my subordinate. I’ll educate this half-witted fool on my end later.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: However, I must say that I share their sentiment in all honesty. Why should we back out now, after we’ve given so much effort?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: I understand how disappointing it may be. All of you have spilled much blood in order to earn your share of turf before the street relocation happens.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: I wish I could give out a sizable chunk of the land for each and every family who have gathered here, I really do.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: But the capo dei capi demands otherwise. We have no choice but to obey it.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: The situation outside is going in an unexpected direction.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: A party other than the Index is involved in this conflict. The ones who pilfered our fabric…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: I am deeply ashamed, sire.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Don’t be too hard on yourself, now. I’ll pardon your manners by taking only your left hand.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Thank you, sire!

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Do understand that we can’t let such trivial issues distract ourselves in times like this.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: We must carry out the capo dei capi’s orders first and foremost.

Dialog.Title: Night Awls
Dialog.Content: …Just what is the capo dei capi thinking to make demands like this.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: When one dares question the orders of their superior, take their head…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: How insolent of you to question the intentions of the capo dei capi. Such impure thoughts should be uprooted.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Purge every member of the Night Awls by tonight.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Yes, sire. I’ll give the word.

Dialog.Title: Ramier Family
Dialog.Content: Talk about an impatient young fellow. It couldn’t have hurt to quietly wait.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: The capo dei capi has told me outright. The Index…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Yes, our boss insisted that we mustn’t let the Index claim a single area of L Corp’s Nest.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: But you, my friends, don’t quite have the prowess to take on the Proxies of the Index. Hence the order to pull out.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: So we should save up our strength at the moment. I understand now.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: This goes to the other sottocapi of the Thumb and their families as well.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Our ambition is not something as short-sighted as taking over a few blocks of space. Do you understand?
Yes, underboss.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Thumb seems to have a quite rigid structure?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Index probably gave you a good idea already, but… yeah. The Fingers have rules and hierarchies that I’d only describe as paranoid.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The specifics may be different, but if anyone breaks their rules, that poor fellow is done for. Although each Finger has its own way of purging rulebreakers.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose that’s the “strategy” they evolved to survive in the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Spot on.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They can only survive by shoving themselves into a sturdy, unbreakable shell.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the five Syndicates that crammed themselves all the way into the core of that hard shell and stood on the apex of the Backstreets earned the title of the ‘Five Fingers’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Welp, in any case, our job as the staff of the Library is to receive any guests that come here, and the Thumb is no exception.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It looks like the Thumb mainly use firearms.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They also seemed to use bullets in various ways, as opposed to the Full-Stop Office we received some time ago.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: These people would swing the gun itself as a melee weapon, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Like I said before, bullets are expensive. Even though the bullets the Thumb uses are self-made, the price is anything but affordable.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They utilize bullets in clever ways depending on the situation, but won’t actually fire them unless it’s a huge deal.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Does that mean they mostly use their guns as a close-range weapon like that, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yup. A good swing can easily crush human bones. The guns are made using pretty nifty technology and materials.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Thumb Southern Base - Meeting Room

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Phew~ Just had a call, it looks like there’s huge fights with the Index going on outside.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: The streets are gonna reek of blood, eh?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It’s not just the streets, the entire Nest is awash with blood…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: The hell is the Liu Association up to anyway, poking around an abandoned Nest?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: The Index and R Corp. are already keeping us swamped…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Besides, there’s been an awful lot of Distortion sightings around here these days. All those feuds took out half my good men.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Everyone seems to be looking for clues on the Distortion. They must’ve determined that the Library sitting at the center of the Nest has to be closely related to that phenomenon.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: And it’s true that the Distortion has been happening here more frequently than any other place.
Greetings, sir.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Sit down now. As you have said, the Index, the Liu, and R Corp. are ransacking this Nest.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It’s not just them, we’ve received reports that the Blue Reverberation and the Purple Tear are also present.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation, you say…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: The one who took our fabric turned out to be working for him.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: I see… What do you think is attracting the Blue Reverberation and his gang here?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It must be the Library. Several well-known individuals and groups fell victim to it, too.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Whoever takes over that Library is gonna be the victor of this tedious battle.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: But whenever we try to go there ourselves, the invitation to the Library just vanishes.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It’s as if they’re refusing to let us in…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: That was true up until now. We tried acquiring it through our subordinates, and claiming it from others with force, but nothing worked…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: However, I directly received an invitation today.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: It says they have a book of the Liu Association up for grabs.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: That’s the book we need the most right now.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: If we can find a way to deal with the Liu Association, then we’re guaranteed to win at least half of this Nest.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It’ll give us a chance to stifle them for sure…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: An underboss bringing all his capos into the Library doesn’t strike me as a good idea, though?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: What’s a Messenger of the Index doing here.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: If you say anything stupid, I’ll pull out your tongue…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: You guys are always on edge.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’m not here to see you bleed today.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: And I reckon you aren’t here to throw cheap jabs at us, either?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Sottocapo Kalo? May I speak to you for a moment?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: I appreciate the Index for upholding basic manners. Go on ahead.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: This is just my opinion, but… I don’t think you should go. You’re most likely to turn into a book there.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: If the underboss managing this area ends up disappearing, it’d only be a matter of time until the Index seizes this place.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: And just think about it; if the Index happens to get your book at the Library, not only will the Thumb have a harder time trying to break the Index, it’ll also put the entire Syndicate at a huge disadvantage. Wouldn’t you agree?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Well, this is a rare occasion. A Messenger, stating their own opinion instead of delivering Prescripts?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: …I only have the patience to acknowledge the Prescripts of the Index, not the personal ramblings of a mere Messenger.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Tell the zealots of the Index remaining in L Corp’s territory this: Once we’ve sorted out this matter, we shall pull out their teeth and tongues, and feed them to the hounds as punishment for insulting the Thumb.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Although you won’t be alive to relay that message with your own mouth.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …So it had to go this way.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: …When one dares irritate their superior, take their tongue.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They execute anyone who ruffles their feathers even so slightly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They don’t care who the offender may be.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It certainly looks like they don’t. Not even the member of another Finger seems to be exempt from their rules.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And remembering what I heard last time… the echelon appeared to matter as well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s right. You have to be courteous to people whose position is higher than yours.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You can’t casually mention their name or speak before they do. You need permission for every little thing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, there are exceptions, strictly speaking… A high class person can theoretically lend the authority of their position to someone else, but it’s a rare case.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Generally speaking, a Grade 1 Fixer is on the same position as a capo in their hierarchy.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You can’t even make eye contact with a person whose class is higher than you… Neither of those Fingers are right in the head, I gotta say.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t know about that. I actually like the straightforwardness of it.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Anyone sustained heavy injuries? We don’t need dead weight getting in our way.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: I’m unharmed, sire.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: It wasn’t easy, though. The Index is a bothersome bunch, even just a Messenger can be a pain in the ass to deal with.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Those who don’t respect their superiors need to be taught a lesson in manners…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Are you going to be alright, sire? The words of that Messenger had a point, it may have been safer… and beneficial for the Thumb if you stayed in the base.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Shouldn’t you be worrying about your own safety first?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: That’s intriguing. I heard that the director of this place was a machine… but I suppose that’s not entirely true.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s rather irritating to hear you go on about whether I’m a machine or not right in front of my face, you know?

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: The ruling figure of a Star of the City stands at a higher echelon than a sottocapo such as myself…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: You ought to pay her due respect, Katriel.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: …That was impolite of me. I’ll pay my price now.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Denis, please cut off my tongue.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Capo
Dialog.Content: Okay…

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Katriel may not be flawless, but I appreciate how she’s quick to reflect on her mistakes.

Dialog.Title: Thumb Sottocapo
Dialog.Content: Please forgive our rudeness with this, madam.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… He was right about you all being sick in the head…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book here, I suppose.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Thumb was bound by their strict decrees, even to death.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And they shove the Thumb’s rules up others’ asses too. Because they have the power to do so.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Who’s making the rules for them, I wonder…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s a tough question. And I don’t think anyone has the answer for that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hell, I bet they don’t even know when those rules were established. They aren’t much better than those zealots chasing Prescripts in that sense.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Do you think they’re dumb for following those unfair rules without even knowing why?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’d be lying if I said no, though I can understand them somewhat.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It certainly seems pathetic that they’re blindly obeying them without knowing the reason even if they have complaints.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: However, there’s little point in questioning things that have always stayed the same and had to stay the same.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A lesson you learned from your previous job?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t paint it as something as nice as that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was what I had to ingrain in my head. Calling it a lesson feels inappropriate to me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s just an observation I made; from what I’ve seen, people who live aimless lives think that they had no other choice. You said the same thing before, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And now, I got to understand it a bit better.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s not that I understand the rules of the Fingers themselves.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Of course, different individuals would see them from various perspectives and judge for themselves whether they’re a good thing or a bad thing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway… The warning that Messenger of the Index gave wasn’t worth nothing; with one of the higher-ups gone, the Thumb could be in actual danger.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: True. The Thumb must be bummed to know that an underboss of theirs is now a book.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Does that make the Index the only Finger remaining in L Corp’s Nest now?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m not so sure about that. It’s up to them to retreat or hold the fort.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not like we need to care about it.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: President, have you seen the request from T Corp?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Well well~ This is such a difficult situation.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Have we been found out…?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: How clumsy of W Corp. to leak its Singularity so carelessly. That’s no good! No good at all!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Though everything went as the Blue Reverberation said in the end, I must admit.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Yes! Indeed! This is a perfect opportunity for us to learn the details of W Corp’s Singularity!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: All we have to do now is visit the Library with this Invitation and earn the books of W Corp’s cleanup crew!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Prez… …The Library is a Star of the City now…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We’ve completed eleven requests regarding Stars of the City until now! Such expertise is why we’re under the direct sponsorship of T Corp!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: When we acquire the confidential information on W Corp’s Singularity, what are you going to do with it? I don’t believe you’ll just return it to W Corp.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We should sell it to the clients that need the technology, of course! A patent war is about to break out, too.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: So we aren’t handing it to T Corp. right away.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Mister Bada! It takes more than just diligent work to rise through the ranks as our Office has!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We should always seek opportunities!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: I was honestly skeptical at first when we were told to entrust work to some irrelevant rubbish like the Gaze Office…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: I thought they were joking with us, but look what it did for us!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Here’s the thing, though…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: See? Squarey head. It went just as I predicted, didn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: It’s a pleasure to meet you for the second time, President Nemo of Cane Office.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: …Here’s the thing! You poncy creep and Wing-forsaken skeleton head. Since when did we agree to go there on our own?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: This is how you screw us over?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We’re supposed to walk into the Library ourselves? Including me?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Six-sided skull. You bragged about taking care of eleven Star of the City-class requests mere moments ago, no? What’s wrong…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Don’t tell me, are you scared…?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: You were listening in on our conversation…?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …This could be problematic…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Ha! Ha! Ha! Oh, you sneaky peepers, you… They say the walls have ears, but it looks like shitbags do, too!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Am I scared?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Well, YES! I’m scared piss-and-shitless, thanks for asking!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Prez got miffed…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s going to be a real hassle cooling him down for a while.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: I did not quite expect the prominent and prestigious Cane Office to swallow their words.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Mister Skullcap! Do I look like scrap for brains?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Your motive is so transparently blatant, I can’t possibly not be terrified!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: If I were to enter the Library? And turn into a book there?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: And then the Library would get a book detailing the Singularities of W Corp. and T Corp? In the same Library where the book about L Corp. is?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Guess who will be getting a hold of three Singularities at once!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: In times like these, when we’re on the brink of a patent war?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Ha! Ha! Ha! It’s so plainly obvious, I don’t see a point to say it twice!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Tell me. Who’s the mastermind behind this. Whose pockets are you trying to fill with your little games.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Dear, dear…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hahaha…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I was wondering what words were going to come out of your agitated speech device…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: That’s all you could think with your rectangular noggin?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Singularities? A patent war?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I can’t even get a chuckle out of it. It’s not funny in the slightest.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You like to raise your voice over the pettiest things like your life depends on them, don’t you, boxy buck. I’m stunned by how puny this is.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Rhombus brain thinks we’re just here to make some bread.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: How idiotic…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: SHUT UP!!!!!!!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Mister Nemonitor. I’m not interested in your views.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Patent war? Mastermind? Money? Think whatever you want. But promises are promises.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Pluto.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Of course, sir. Ladies and gents, please have another look at the contract.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: To summarize the point, we will provide Cane Office with information about W Corp’s Singularity.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: And in return, Cane Office will secure books from the Library for us, when we want them.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: The signatures of Mister Nemo, Miss Martina, Mister Bada, and the leader of our ensemble, Argalia, are clearly written here.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: We weren’t told that the information about W Corp’s Singularity would be provided in the form of books from the Library. Not to mention having to acquire it ourselves.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: The terms were in rather ambiguous vocabulary, admittedly.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: However, that would not make the content of this contract any less appropriate under the current circumstances.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …You aren’t one to decide that…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Cube-boy’d taken the pen like lightning and he signed the contract in haste, making a huge fuss about a patent war or whatever, wasn’t it? I’m pretty sure he said he’s in urgent need of intel about the Singularities.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: The contract never specified that we are to head to the Library ourselves. It only said “Cane Office” is going.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: You should’ve checked the terms carefully. Here, take a look.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I’m not seeing a thing…

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Let me lend you my eyeglass, dear. Have a closer look at the fine print.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …“All those who sign this contract must retrieve books at the Library”…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: What foolish deception. Do you think you’ll get off scot-free after meddling with our business?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: What makes you think we’ll abide by your fraudulent contract at this point?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Dear, dear…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: This thing is no ordinary contract, you see…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah, what was it called, Pluto?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: It would be ‘Yesterday's Promise’.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Right, that. Yesterday’s Promise! Not my type of name, to be honest.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Anyway, if you don’t fulfill the conditions of this contract, he can take anything out of those who signed the paper, see? We can take as much as we want, whenever we want.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: …Nonsense!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Pluto.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Lo and behold. This is Mister Bada’s heart.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Kuhrgh…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Bada…!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: You’ve spent quite a fortune on your body. I can see this heart is augmented with an exquisite procedure.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Here, I’ve returned it to you.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: See, ol’ oblong? I don’t care about what you think; I just want you to keep the promises you made with me.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Besides, T Corp. directly issued the same order to you, so you have to be there anyhow, no? Seething with anger at us won’t spare you from going to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Let me ask something!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hm?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: What are you plotting to do with demons like that?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’ll perform the beauty of humanity and this world.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It will break down the boundaries of loneliness we all have…

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: We’d appreciate it if you could get the job done by today.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: …Beauty…? Loneliness…?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Ha! Ha! Ha! Brainsick looney…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Bada, is your heart okay…? …Should we go see a doctor…?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: They’re gone…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …What are we gonna do now, prez…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Well! It looks like we’ve been had!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Are you really sure we’ll be alright going by ourselves underprepared…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Let’s think simplistically, everyone. Don’t get too serious!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We’ll head into the Library, take the books, and come back! That’s all there is to it!

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Let’s get ready!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I remember that skeleton, he was with the Blue Reverberation the last time we saw him.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Mmhmm. He said something about ‘Yesterday's Promise’.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I think I read about it in one of the guests’ books. On the surface, it appears to be an ordinary contract, but unfavorable terms are hidden in the fine print.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was speculated to be the cause of some kind of incident, although I’m not quite sure if the claim is verifiable…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s even more obscene to see it in action. That’s such a manipulative scheme.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, I suppose. He’s far from being the only manipulative guy in the City, though.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s true. People use each other all the time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Do you think that’s a given?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I simply gave up dwelling on it any further. I still don’t believe that’s fair.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In a similar vein, you’re using me and I’m using you.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If you say so, I guess.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t worry. I don’t mean to imply any distrust towards you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s just… yes, keeping the options open, that’s all. Better safe than sorry, as they say.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hey, I never told you any lies, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re only keeping a few things from me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Mm… I guess I am.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Forget it. Why don’t you go back to sorting books, now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You won’t bother being inquisitive, huh… Is there any reason you aren’t asking further?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: None in particular… I could certainly pry, but I figured it wouldn’t be fun to uncover everything about you that way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I came to the conclusion that having something to be curious of is beneficial for maintaining interpersonal relationships, that’s all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Or perhaps I’ve grown to trust you that much.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: We were led by monsters out of the pan and into the flame: a den of monsters known as the Library.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: This has to be comedy gold, the joke of the century.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: I heard the Library is rather gentle, if that helps.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: …Just a moment.

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Is anything the matter?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Martina!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: What do you think of this place?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s faint, but… I can smell something…

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Exactly! It reeks of money, profit!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: You can’t even smell with that head.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Every cloud has a silver lining, and looks like we’ve found one!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you planning to sell books or something?

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Precisely! Even if our reputation as a contract Office may tank, at least we won’t starve to death if we get books from here and sell them!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you… swimming in cash already, prez…?

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Martina, our president spends a year’s worth of an average Backstreets dweller’s food expenses every day. He can never have enough money.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Still, I never bilked my Office staff, my word upon it!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: You must be Angela, the director of this place, the so-called ‘Pale Librarian’!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: She doesn’t look pale at all, though.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Bada! Watch your words.

Dialog.Title: Cane President
Dialog.Content: Miss Angela here may be our precious provider of goods and wealth in the future!

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: Prez changes his attitude so swiftly…

Dialog.Title: Cane Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m used to it by now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose “patent wars” are fiercely fought, judging from the way he talked about it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. All in all, technology is the most reliable means of making money in this City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Patent wars are waged over those technologies, but in truth, neither side really benefits from them. It ends in a Pyrrhic victory at best.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If they don’t respond well, they might lose their rights to the technology by an imitation, or spend too much time and energy for the win to have been worthwhile… At the end of the day, people like the guests we just greeted profit the most from those conflicts.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, it’s entertaining to spectate as long as the trouble isn’t yours. I’ve got a bunch of interesting stories, wanna hear them?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Save the whole thing for a later time. It sounds like it’ll be a long tale.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Has R Corp. participated in a patent war?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Dunno. I don’t think I heard any stories about that, at least. R Corp. is already exceptional among private military contractors.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How about the Singularity of another Wing? Has R Corp. tried to get a hold of any?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I bet every Wing thinks the same way about that matter. Few Wings use their Singularity on its own.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: R Corp. must be using a Singularity or two that doesn’t belong to them, you know what I mean? And they gotta pay the owners a fee whenever they use them.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If they uncovered the secrets of those Singularities owned by other Wings, they could save that expense, correct?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Spot on.

Place.PlaceName: Location: A Laboratory in the Outskirts

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: This is highly disappointing.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I am sorry, Sir Argalia…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I was so sure I would find an answer if I came all the way here.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: But no, not a single soul here has a lead…

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: Cough… What did you expect to see in a shabby fringe of the Outskirts…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The Red Mist began harnessing that power of hers after this place had become her base of operations, no?

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: We don’t know anything about the Red Mist… We were just taking shelter in an abandoned laboratory…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: They had to have left something here… Don’t you have any guesses, my friends?

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: The monsters are about to come. Please… Let us go now, you’ve had enough…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You folks aren’t helping at all, sadly.

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: We already told you that none of us know a damn thing about this facility! Why won’t you listen to us!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You’d better hurry up and recall useful information, friends. This is driving me crazy, too.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Following her charming voice, I dropped by every little venue I could guess to be relevant. I searched every nook and cranny for hints.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: In the end, L Corp, the Library, and… this used-to-be lab were the only three candidates remaining.

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: They’re coming… they’ll be here any moment! They’ll come for us if you don’t close the doors!!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The Pianist, who showed up in the middle of the streets… It took my sister…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t be there as it happened, unfortunately…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Upon my belated arrival at the scene, all that greeted me… was the grand piano with its performer gone.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: My sister had become one of the many keys and strings of the piano, joining in the last performance…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: What she had become was utterly indescribable.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Not because it was horrible, no…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Rather, it was just too beautiful for words…

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: Aaaaaaack!!!! Can’t you hear the sound of clockwork?! They’re coming!!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I suppose it’s my fault for letting my dear younger sister marry an imbecile. I couldn’t stop her…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Throughout our lives, we could never quite understand each other; our hearts were too far apart to keep each other company…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It was through the performance that we could finally see the feelings of one another…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I shivered with pain and despair for losing my naive and adorable hoyden…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: And looking at what once was my sister, I trembled from the enticing melody it created…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: That’s when my eyes were opened. I could see it…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I could envision what I can do for her…

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: Aah… They’re here… Wings have mercy…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Playing a gorgeous melody, a neverending dirge… in remembrance of dear Angelica…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: A gentle voice whispered to me…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: That I shall be able to reenact that glorious performance.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I wandered around following her advice, but I couldn’t find a definitive answer anywhere…

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: Gahhhhh!!! It’s them… Clockwork Teeth are here!! Everyone, run!!!! Don’t let them take a single strand of hair!!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: No, no. I didn’t come all the way here to see some sloppily made creatures…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Pluto? Eileen?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Yes, Sir Argalia.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Shall I shut them down for you? Clockwork is rubbishy compared to gears.

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: …How… How did you stop the flesh clockwork…? What are you people…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: After wandering for a while, a revelation finally flashed in my head.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah, yes, it bore a striking resemblance to the beauty the Red Mist manifested as she danced with blood in her mouth.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The Pianist and the Red Mist showed vastly different colors of elegance, yet they were so alike at the core…

Dialog.Title: Outskirts Resident
Dialog.Content: Give up, pals… He’s worse than the monsters…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
