Dialog.Content: What a shame, I’ve got nothing. This invitation is the only lead I have now…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Eileen, care to lend me a few of your sheep?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: As you wish. Are you sure you don’t need our company?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Don’t worry, I’ll be back in no time. It’s not ripe yet, anyway…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Pluto, stick around for a bit longer and see if there’s anything noteworthy here.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: But of course, sir.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: His two buddies have got to be Distortions, I’m one hundred and ten percent sure…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And one of them seems oddly familiar, now that I think about it…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Is it just me, or is there a hint of sadness in the Blue Reverberation’s face?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You mean the Blue Sicko. He’s just lost it from the shock of losing his sister.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Pianist caused tons of people to part with their precious things in one way or another, but he in particular had to lose it in the worst way possible…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: When someone as powerful as him goes completely wacko and starts pillaging everywhere, there’s literally no way to stop him.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He said his sister was named Angelica. That sounds similar to my name.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, yeah. I’m guessing they mean the same thing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: By the way, what were those entities they called “Clockwork Teeth”? Are they the creatures of the Outskirts?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Outskirts are where things abandoned and rejected from entering the City by the Head go.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s basically a junkyard for ‘impurities’ of the City. Most people rarely get a chance to see the Outskirts throughout their lives, so they don’t even know that those things exist.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A lot of the “monsters” living there are artificial creations made by humans or things brought from the outside.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And I heard that a good chunk of them have sentience and emotions.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re non-humans, impurities whose existence is unacceptable in the City, especially in this age of humanity.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Just like me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guest. I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Angelica…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My name is Angela, dear guest.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Yeah, you’re right. There’s no way something as hideous as you could be her.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Why don’t you stop spouting such uncouth nonsense and head inside already?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: A power so potent that even a machine may become human…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It’s as I suspected. The Library has to ripen…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hang in there, Angelica. It won’t be long.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Crap… We lost him.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: We couldn’t get a proper book out of him, either.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I really wanted to take a peek at that lunatic’s mind for once…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you need that person’s book above anything else?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …It’s for personal reasons, to be frank.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation seemed to be after the Red Mist…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then, perhaps a book of the Red Mist could lure him back here again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I appreciate the thought, but how exactly are we gonna do that? You know the original Red Mist kinda doesn’t exist anymore.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: About that, we might have a way around it…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Say, the Blue Reverberation said he lost his sister to a Distortion, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is he aware that I was the cause of that phenomenon?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He’s no ordinary guy, so it’s possible he’s noticed it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then the Blue Reverberation’s goal may be taking revenge on me, perhaps.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No, rather… Anyone who lost what they found precious to the Distortion would resent me once they learned I was responsible for the phenomenon.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, maybe. Do you regret it or anything?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not really sure. All I can say for certain is that it’s not exactly pleasant to know that the resentment against me is growing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even then, it was ultimately the fault of the one man who trapped me inside for eons that the City came to suffer.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I feel much better thinking about it that way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t care if the Blue Reverberation wants vengeance or not.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s but one of the many clashes between my desire and the City folks’ desires.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Right you are. That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Hnff… How many do we have left to skewer?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: One hundred and ninety-three.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Would you please stay still~!

Dialog.Title: The Thumb
Dialog.Content: How could you do this when the Finger Bow-Bell is imminent…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Don’t act like it’s anything new, this isn’t even the first time we’ve had a quarrel with the Thumb~ Your boss isn’t gonna make a big deal out of this, y’know~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: “Remove the limbs of all Thumb personnel still remaining in the Nest. And hang their bodies on skewers…”

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We’re simply carrying out our Prescript. No personal feelings are involved in this process.

Dialog.Title: The Thumb
Dialog.Content: You fanatics, you’re blind and deaf to anything but your Prescripts… Obeying them without a second thought…! I can’t fathom how you stake your lives on following orders from nowhere…!!!

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Isn’t that how everyone in the City lives? We’re all fundamentally the same, aside from the variation in methods.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: And that’s the end of this Prescript~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …We only have one Prescript left to carry out now.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It’s quite a magnificent sight to see those limbless bodies make futile struggles with their fading consciousnesses.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: That makes the Index the last Finger standing in L Corp’s Nest.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: The only other obstacles remaining are the beasts of R Corp, and the Blue Reverberation.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: All hail the Prescript~ I love how it always leads us to blissful places~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Prescripts are just meant to be followed.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: It’s not a good idea to give extra meaning or have any sentiment for them…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Some big mouth you have, Mister Messenger~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: You were barely alive when we found you, your lower jaw destroyed and your tongue and eyes gone~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: If it weren’t for the Prescripts, you might not have gotten any treatment, let alone lived~?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I still don’t thank the Prescripts or anything.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …That’s just them being carried out.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: The Messenger is correct. Prescripts are to be fulfilled—it’s as simple as that.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Messenger Yan demonstrated it well through his past actions.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Gee, dear… The scent of blood is in the air. I’m not one to speak, but the Index really hasn’t changed.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I don’t believe we’re mutually hospitable enough to be having chats in such close proximity, now?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hum, friends, no need to be so wary.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’m here to ask you a favor, Proxy Esther.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I was wondering if I could take those heaps of flesh on the skewers you prepared.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It looks like you’re done with your Prescript anyway. It never told you to keep them hanging forever, no?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Yet it did not tell us to bring them down.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It’s up to you to interpret the messages, so I’m personally asking you, Proxy friends.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: This is tough~ What do we do~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I really don’t wanna let him get away with what he wants, but there’s no good reason to refuse~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: …Let the Blue Reverberation do whatever he wants with them.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We only need to see to it that the Prescripts are fulfilled one after another. There is no need to cause unnecessary conflict.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: That’s a clear explanation.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Good wisdom as always. I’m glad we won’t have to see each other’s guts today.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It’s always a delight to talk with Proxies, you see. They have a similar scent as mine…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Mmh, you know, I’d love to recruit maybe one of you to my ensemble.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I have no interest in learning what you’re trying to do, and I suggest you cut your antics short while you still can.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Is that so? I’m sure you’d like it once you heard it…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Anyway… We’d better take them while they’re fresh, right? I’m counting on you.

Dialog.Title: The Musicians of Bremen
Dialog.Content: Ruff yap, ruff!! Neighhh~ Bwwakbawk!

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Pah, you’re right. He always dumps the tedious chores on us.

Dialog.Title: The Eight Chefs
Dialog.Content: Hawhawhaw! Look at how the meat’s skewered nicely on these sticks… It’s like I’m looking at fine brochettes with a delicious smell!

Dialog.Title: The Eight Chefs
Dialog.Content: I know! This’ll make a perfect treat if I spread a mix of soy sauce and ground garlic on this and then grill it! What do you say, mixer face?

Dialog.Title: The Musicians of Bremen
Dialog.Content: NEIIIGH~! BARK!! NEIGH!!!

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Some appetite you’ve got there. They did a good job of chopping the meat into nice chunks, I’ll give them that; but the meat itself isn’t very high quality.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Easy, friends. We need them for other things. As long as you carry them all in mint condition… I’ll let you have two or three, maybe.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Of course, that’s up to Jae-heon to decide, though.

Dialog.Title: The Eight Chefs
Dialog.Content: No worries! He’ll definitely allow it when I tell him that I’m gonna make mind-blowing cuisine out of it!

Dialog.Title: The Eight Chefs
Dialog.Content: Oh, he’ll have to! Hawhaw!!

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Guess we’re having a barbecue party for the first time in a long while.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: You’re being quite loud for someone keeping others waiting.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Sorry about that. We get along much too well with each other, as you can see~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: …The Blue Reverberation, as long as you’ve chosen to roost in this Nest, know that you and your minions will have your guts spilt upon this land one day.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Really, is that what you think? I beg to differ…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Methinks the little animal friends from R Corp. are the only ones you’ll get to gut, rather?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation is still an obnoxious spook~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: There’s no need to pay him much attention unless the Prescript commands us to.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: …Messenger Yan. Is the next Prescript prepared?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Sure. Here you are.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Let me guess, it says “Esther, Gloria, Hubert, and the Proselytes under them shall head to the Library.” …Am I correct?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Mm? The Library~? Guess we’re going there ourselves, after all~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …How did you know that?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: You look surprised, Messenger Yan.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We were already aware that the Prescripts you’ve been delivering to us were illegitimate.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: What~? I was the only one being fooled?!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …Since when did you notice?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: That matters little.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: If you knew the Prescripts were fake, then why did you still declare war against the Thumb… And why are you about to dig your own grave by going into the Library?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I simply followed the Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It commanded me to “Carry out every Prescript delivered by Messenger Yan.”

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …So the Prescripts knew, then.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Just how much do they know, really…?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We cannot escape from the Prescripts. Every thought and action of ours is within the boundaries of Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I don’t understand! But Yan’s been a good boy, fulfilling many Prescripts throughout his life?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Yan~ Why’d you betray us! Was it for money?!

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Gloria, there is no such thing as betrayal in our vocabulary. All that matters is whether or not one has carried out their Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hah…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’m sick and tired of this! Those stupid Prescripts are everywhere…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’ve lost so many things, abandoned and neglected so much because of the Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I lost my family, killed my friends with my own two hands, stole precious things from people and looked the other way…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I was ridden with guilt, but I forced myself to do it anyway. Because the Prescripts must be carried out!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: The Prescripts… guide us to the right path, they said.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: But have they really led me along the right path?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I resented Prescripts; I feared them; I loathed them; I didn’t even want to look at them again; And then… a Prescript gave me the role of the Messenger.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Delivering Prescripts… with my own hands?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: So I began making fake Prescripts. I thought I was showing my will for the first time with that act…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: But then the Prescripts do this, as if they knew everything already…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Tell me, Esther. Was this… not done out of my own will all along?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It doesn’t matter if you did it of your volition or not.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It’s our obligation to follow the Prescripts. And the Prescript now tells us to head to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: And ask yourself this: Does free will truly exist in this City?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Proxies. We shall go to the Library this instant.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: You don’t even have an invitation, though.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I’ve already received one.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: But how. The order to head to the Library was just a lie I made up…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Messenger Yan. The Prescript has invited you to a certain place.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: The Prescript… invited me?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Are you guys actually going to the Library, then?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: As the Prescript orders.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I guess you would’ve said the same even if I brought you a Prescript telling you to die on the spot.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We move according to the Prescripts at all times.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t you wonder what the Blue Reverberation is up to?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We’ll see soon enough. Although I’m not exactly thrilled to find out…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: By the way, Blue Sicko’s got more new members for his band of freaks, from the looks of it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen that wolfhead, but I… don’t think we’ve seen the other two before.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: One of them seemed rather enthusiastic about cooking.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Hmm.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you have any guesses?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, it’s no big deal. I was just reminded of the stories I read the other day about the guests we received from District 23. That’s all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Besides, we have the Proxies of the Index to deal with first.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Index… A Finger that acts strictly based on Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s curious how he forged false Prescripts, but it looks like the Prescripts anticipated that as well.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah. Whoever’s making those must be a genius at precalculations.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They make seemingly weird instructions, and those Prescripts end up benefiting the Index in some odd ways, like their maker is somehow omniscient.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I imagine that the one who makes the Prescripts is quite an impressive individual.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Probably is. You gotta be a cut above the rest to be leading a Syndicate as colossal as a Finger.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That doesn’t make those Prescript-worshipping zealots any less insane, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is anything wrong?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Nothing, I was just having some thoughts for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Hellooooo~~ Anyone there~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Such unnecessary rowdiness.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. I am Angela, the dir—

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Whaaa~? You’re a human~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Is she? Seems rather ambiguous to me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t believe that’s relevant right now.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: The director of the Library, also known as ‘The Pale Librarian’, was supposed to be a machine to my knowledge.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Perhaps we should update the knowledge base with this new information…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: She’s a liger~ I’m surprised to see such an awkward freak still exist in the City~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Ooh, look at her, she’s razor sharp~ Are you getting mad~?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You are to overcome the ordeals in this place and fight for the rewards, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Please go through that door if you wish to enter.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: …And you’re calmer than what the current information suggests.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Proxies. Our primary directive is to enter the Library as the Prescript dictates. Stop this quarrel and get on with it.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Mkay~

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You know, sometimes, it doesn’t sound too bad to just let go of all complicated thoughts and follow orders like the Index does.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I think otherwise. You won’t be better than a corpse if you just mindlessly perform tasks as they’re given to you, and the Index looks just like walking corpses in that regard.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They appear to have no respect for the free will of individuals.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm… You know, I do have a thing or two to say about performing tasks as they’re given.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Here’s the difference: Both you and I are working hard in order to get out of this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: We have a clear goal set in our minds. We’re doing this because we wish to be free.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: However… Yan’s efforts to prove that he has a will of his own went up in smoke.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You used to berate it hard, calling people who follow it pathetic and stuff. Have you changed your mind on that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Perhaps I have.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I thought they were nothing more than completely meaningless arrays of words… for those who have no purpose in life…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As you pointed out, the Prescripts of the Index end up benefiting the Syndicate.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That Prescript commanded them to eliminate all members of the Thumb in L Corp’s Nest. Right when an Underboss and his Capos have disappeared.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Prescripts Yan had been delivering were false, but an invitation to the Library was in that man’s hand as if it were destined to occur.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And they knew that he was up to something. It’s like they’re seeing one step ahead… heck, three steps, maybe.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yeah. I thought they were no more than zealots wasting away their lives and time…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But that was a hasty judgement I made from mere fragments. Could the Prescripts actually be as omniscient as they make them out to be, Roland?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whether that’s true or not, I don’t think you have to be so unnerved about ‘em, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Prescripts could be some grand entity or a big ball of nothing for all I know. Point is, there’s no need to pay too much attention to what they say.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Even if everything I’ve been doing was actually done out of the City’s will and not mine, that doesn’t matter to me one bit since there’s no way for me to realize that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What I do know is that the emotions I feel are wholly mine.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …The emotions you feel.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Thanks for putting it that way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I gotta wonder, though. Where was that Messenger going?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He was apparently invited by a Prescript… To where he was invited is still a mystery for us.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Talk about a cliffhanger… Always gotta tease me this way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You seem quite interested.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Who knows? He might lead us to the full story behind the Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even then, we won’t get to see it if he isn’t our guest.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hngh… Good point.

Place.PlaceName: Location: L Corp’s Nest, Liu Section 1 Operation Camp

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Man, I’m dog-tired…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …What the hell is the Blue Reverberation up to.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s what you’re worried about? How are we even gonna explain this to the Association in our report…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We don’t have much choice. Just gotta describe what we saw there. There’s nothing we can do about him.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Speaking of, I don’t think we’ve heard from Section 2 ever since they went on an expedition to the Library. Did something happen to them?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: They’re probably just too busy with the work. Director Xiao must be worried quite a bit, still.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Well, we have our own problems to worry about. We’ve got a few things left to wrap up, so let’s head back inside, shall we?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Pardon the interruption late at night, director. We have a number of issues to address regarding the cases we’ve recently taken care of…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Director?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …Ah, sorry. I was distracted with thoughts for a moment. Don’t mind me.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: You said you have a report to make. What is it?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: A number of experts are going to extract samples from the Distortions we’ve captured after failing to secure the Crying Children, and send them to V Corp.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The process is estimated to take a full day. Will we be put on standby in the meantime?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Have you received any contact from the president or the executive board?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. They told Section 1 to stay clear of this matter.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Hana Association will be taking over further affairs regarding the Library and the Distortion after monitoring the situation for a little longer.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: They felt the need to take their time to carry out a more thorough analysis and review of the Library now that it’s a Star of the City, I see…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are we going to pull out of this Nest, then?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. You’ll be going back as soon as the extraction is done, so pack your belongings in advance.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Until then, rest up and get yourselves back into optimal shape. You ought to be prepared for any task.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Understood, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’ll be going now, so have a good rest, dir—

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Wait.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Listen carefully to what I have to say.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Section 1’s next post will most likely be the Outskirts, where the strife between the Ring and the Pinky is still fierce.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: We should especially be cautious of the Pinky, so keep that in mind once you’re dispatched to that area.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Duly noted.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Miris, overconfidence is your biggest flaw. Be mindful of that, and you won’t face much hardship in the future.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Chun, stay on track and proceed. You have the qualities to be assigned a color one day.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Why are you telling us this all of a sudden, director…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Don’t tell me, has there been other news from our superiors?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: No. I mentioned all the news I received to you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Instead, I received this piece of paper called the “Invitation” from the Library. It was placed on the middle of my desk, so I couldn’t miss it.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: That means, a bit ago, you…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: You guessed right… Effective immediately, I’m resigning from my position as Director of Section 1 of the Liu.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll take all responsibility and penalty for the unilateral resignation and breach of contract by myself. You don’t have to worry about your careers.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What… did you just say?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’m saying that my action will not hurt your careers.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You know that’s not what I mean!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Inside the briefcase behind me are documents containing all the information I could gather about the process of transferring my position to someone else.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: That may not be exactly sufficient… But please do understand as we have no time to return to the Association HQ at the moment.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I am terribly sorry to suddenly abandon my position, everyone.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re heading to the Library, aren’t you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: This isn’t like you, Director Xiao. You know you shouldn’t make such a hasty decision on this matter…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I suggest going back to the Association and gathering more intel. There has to be some useful information.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: You are right. This isn’t like me. It truly isn’t…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: It would ill become me to be tearful, and yet… I cried for the first time in my life. I never knew I’d have any relation to such sentiments.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I was reminded of Lowell’s earnest request. He asked that we do not throw our lives away, no matter what happened to each other.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I thought he was stating the obvious… I thought I could remain calm and cold.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: But when I was faced with loss in reality, I simply couldn’t get over it. I’m ashamed of myself for this disgraceful behavior.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Anger… heartbreak, despair, sorrow.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: What should I call this emotion I feel… I’m not certain.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: There is one thing I do know for sure.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen countless lies and falsehoods as I climbed the ranks.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I believed that everything in the City was deceit packaged as truth. My life was full of such lies, after all.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: The feelings toward Lowell in my heart, however, were true.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I get where you’re coming from, director.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Still, stepping down from your position like this will be unfavorable in more ways than one.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: If you break an Association’s trust, you will be excluded from this business in one way or another, even if you open up an Office later. And that’s not all. After…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Even then!

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Has there ever been a time when I was so worried sick?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Has there ever been a time when my heart ached from parting?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Has there ever been a time when I wailed, pining for someone dearly…?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Lowell helped me realize that my heart is sincere.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Thus, I shall gladly surrender my body to the flame of passion for him, to prove that there was meaning to my life.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: How could you say it so proudly, ma’am. Director Lowell did, and now you, too…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Alright, Xiao… Let me ask you this straight out.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Let’s say that you managed to get Lowell’s book. Then what? Are you doing this with any plans for the next step in mind?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …No. I have none. I’m simply trying to fulfill the will of my heart.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You should know very well how others will look at you if a big-name Fixer, like you, acts emotionally in situations like this.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: There won’t be a place for you to return. Is that what you want?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Even if stars were to rise in my sky someday, what good would they be without a companion to watch them together…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve already made up my mind. You won’t convince me otherwise.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Do you know that we’ll be following you?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …I expected that somewhat.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And you’re not trying to stop us…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: If you help me… I’ll have a better chance of getting his book.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re being so selfish, ma’am.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What else can we really do when you start acting in a way you’ve never done before.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I won’t force you. You’re free to choose to stay.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: If you still choose to follow me, however… You’ll have my eternal gratitude.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …The hell did I just watch?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe you weren’t entirely correct about Fixers, seeing that even the Section 1 director of an Association can make such an emotional judgement.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m shocked, too. Who could’ve seen that Xiao of all people would be blinded by love…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks like the light that shone during the White Nights and Dark Days had more influence than just creating the Distortion or E.G.O, huh…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The impression I’m getting from all the guests I’ve watched from here is that, well… People have gotten more honest than usual.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And what we have seen reinforces that.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can understand her to a degree. If something were to happen to you, I’d also…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Whoa, what? Don’t tell me, you’re saying… you’re in, like…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: H-Hold on, but my mind isn’t ready yet…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Roland, please save your breath and cut the bullshit.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I know best what my sentiment toward you is, and it isn’t love.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, alright, I know what it’s really about, alright. You mean it’s gonna be tough to find another person like me to chat with, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Correct. It will be extremely grueling to find and build a relationship with another companion on your level from scratch.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: So, at the end of the day we’ve come to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: I can already picture the branch leader furiously grilling us.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’m deeply sorry for you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What’s done is done. The choice was ours.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Let’s focus on taking care of business now that we’ve stepped into this place.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And our deviation might be extenuated if we produce good results in the Library.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I am fine with this place being my grave.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: All of you, on the other hand, should value your own lives more than anything.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, I know that this is a humiliating thing for me to say when you’ve already followed me here.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re awfully brazen, ma’am. Let’s just rule out the possibility of any one of us dying here.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: If we get kicked out of the Liu, you’d better give us new jobs to obtain our grain.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: You have my word.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I’m afraid I’m not in the mood to greet you back with hospitality, but manners are manners…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: My name is Xiao, and next to me are Chun and Miris. Greet her, men.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Hello.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Yes, thank you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What’s with the hesitation, Miss. Feeling guilty for what you’ve done after all this time?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you know what fate your colleagues wearing the same uniforms as yours suffered here, don’t you?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: …Indeed I do.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yet you’ve made this choice. You were not ordered or coerced by anyone else, either.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …You’d better watch your tongue, Miss Library Director.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You talk like we’re already destined to die here.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Enough, you two. What is your point, Library Director?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m simply curious about the psychology of humans… which I know little of.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And of the reason you’re trying to earn him back in spite of the imminent danger.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve also, no… I have seen it more times than I can count, a story of someone looking for substitutes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: From my experience, I cannot understand how you can value your goal more than your own life.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Are you trying to assert that I’ll be able to find a replacement for him out there if I tried?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That is correct. That way, you won’t have to throw away your precious life.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: A machine won’t truly understand. The feeling of burning blood coursing through my veins because of something I cherish.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: The desire to have it back by any means, in any form.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: “Precious” is not a word you should utter as lightly as you just did…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Dreams, hopes, ideals; all the words that describe what motivate humans to get up and live…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Those words encompass meanings too grand for description… But it’s simple at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I still find that insufficient reason to risk your own life.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I won’t deny that. I presume others will overcome the loss of what is precious to them in different ways.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then why have you entered this place with such pride? Was it ungrounded confidence that you’re stronger than us?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Or were you merely blind with anger?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: That… is what I would like to know as well.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: However, I know that this emotion I’m bearing isn’t wrath or sorrow.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You can talk big, but it doesn’t make your life any less futile. To walk into the jaws of death for a meaning of existence?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sure, you can act all confident right now; because you think you’re firm and sturdy.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But, when unexpected situations start to unfold before you… Will that firmness of yours last?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I think not. You’ll be the first to break down, rather.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In the end, it’s having a faint hope that just becomes pointless in the face of death.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What can your trifling resolve change?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Is this some kind of warning to turn back?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have neither the power nor right to stop you.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re really getting on our nerves now…

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Fixer
Dialog.Content: She’s definitely looking down on us. Let’s just get in now, director.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. I have the hope that I will find Lowell’s book here.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Even if I think of myself as firm, I cannot stop others from thinking that I’m petty. You’re free to think of me as a pathetic human being.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t care less about how others view me.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: What will a resolve change, you ask?

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Of course it will not do much. Hope won’t magically illuminate the path ahead. It won’t always be bright.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: It will be similar to despair in a way… I might be lost in the dark, not knowing what to do or where to go.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: It doesn’t give me a path… Nor does it brighten the way… The two are truly alike.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: However, they’re still considered two separate concepts with two separate words; because there is a difference to be found.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: The right thing… By bearing in mind what I must do this instant, and taking it to action, the impossible can be achieved.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: Hope allows one to touch the untouchable… reach the unreachable… and see the invisible.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: I won’t let your words break me; I won’t stand back… Pòfǔchénzhōu. The cauldrons were broken, and the boats were sunk; there is no retreat.

Dialog.Title: Liu S. Section 1 Director
Dialog.Content: So let us enter if you are not afraid of us!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That form… It’s oddly reminiscent.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure. I can’t exactly tell if that was a Distortion or E.G.O.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That one guy ran off with her at the speed of sound, to be fair… No wonder we couldn’t get a good look at it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Was it confusion… I wonder what the reason was.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What motivated him to do such a thing?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Didn’t expect him to care for his boss that much… I’ve seen people run off on their own, but dragging someone else along so they can both live? That’s new.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Though the woman who got nabbed was determined to fight and win.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Will they come back to the Library?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t know. What will happen next is a mystery as always.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All I got to see for sure was horns and a snake’s scales growing out of her… I guess.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That was a transitional phase of some kind, I assume. It was likely a sign of gradual progress.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t tell if that was a Distortion or not because there’s such a fine line. What we saw won’t be sufficient clues for now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s how it works, huh… The whole thing about lines of emotions is still lost on me, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What are you pondering about this time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m just frustrated at the lack of a clear answer.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway, we will have to wait and see for now. We don’t even know what has become of them yet.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You called me here all of a sudden… What’s up?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Remember when I said we might be able to lure the Blue Reverberation using a theoretical book of the Red Mist?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, you’re ready to do that?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hold on… You aren’t actually gonna turn Gebura into a book, are you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wouldn’t do such a ruthless thing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s a few things the Red Mist left behind, and I could use them to invite the Red Mist in her former glory as our guest.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I think I could recreate her somehow.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though she can only exist within the bounds of the Library, of course.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So we’re basically simulating her?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose you could put it that way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But we need books to invite guests here. What kind of books are we gonna have to prepare for attracting the Red Mist?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Books about Lobotomy Corporation.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s the deal, huh… I get the gist of it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I plan to limit certain Patron Librarians from receiving the Red Mist.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Cause she’s too tough for them?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s not the reason, no. Could the Red Mist stomach wielding her blade against those she worked with?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’d clearly have adverse effects on both sides.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s better to have her fight complete strangers, huh…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Red Mist of the past… Who knew that we’d be facing her in person.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s intriguing indeed. How does it feel?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Thrilling, but also makes me worried…

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …The hell is this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: This is my first time seeing you in this form, Gebura.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: Gebura? What gibberish are you saying. And who are you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s a fair reaction, I suppose…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Should I call you Kali, then?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I said, who’re you…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake. I invited you here.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: What? Library? Invited?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: Am I in yet another weird factory or some shady experimenting grounds…

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: No wait, that still doesn’t make sense… I could’ve sworn I was inside the laboratory on the fringe of the Outskirts…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I need to know who you exactly are at the moment, so let me ask you a few questions.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you happen to have acquaintance with a person named Carmen?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …I knew it, some Wing must be pulling this bullshit trying to trample on us, huh?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s no need to be so wary.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Answer a few questions of mine, then I can give you the answer you lot are looking for.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: Go ahead.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Cogito. A book containing the information on how to obtain the substance you’re desperately looking for is waiting beyond this door.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I simply want to make an offer.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …What do you want? I’m warning you, if you try to pull any nonsense on me, this place is gonna be reduced to rubble.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s simple. First, I want to know the current situation of your group.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …If I answer your questions… you’ll tell me how to get Cogito for sure, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Of course. Mountains of books containing various kinds of knowledge are stored here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I simply record and collect such books.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …Alright. I’ll trust you this once.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Good. Is Daniel among your peers?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …If you’re talking about that blue-haired nerd, then yeah.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How about Lisa?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …She’s with us.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Enoch’s corpse is in storage after an experiment on him went wrong, if I’m correct?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then I suppose Elijah is naturally still working there?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …Yes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It must be when the Red Mist was writing her own legend.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The time when she struggled to protect the grief-stricken Carmen and her colleagues from outside threats.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Oh how pitiful. Is there a word to describe how unfortunate your situation was?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Every researcher in Carmen’s team must have been walking on eggshells, cautious not to hurt her further with words.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They consoled her in her presence, but probably resented her behind her back.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: She started the whole project with her convincing speeches, but the research showed no progress, and all they’d been seeing were losses and sacrifices.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t you find her hypocrisy of demurely perpetrating sins while preaching goodness… despicable?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …Look, my patience has its limits.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: If you don’t tell me how to acquire Cogito properly, then I won’t simply pass over what you just said.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: You have no right to make a mockery of our efforts… or her sincerity.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …No right, you say.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Never mind. I suppose that was too hostile of me. I won’t even gain anything from saying such bitter things to you now.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: At least you have the heart to apologize.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I know when to admit my faults, that’s all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Kali. Let me ask you one question.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …What is it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen many sides of Fixers while taking care of this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Most of them were motivated by wealth and fame.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But you’re different. Even without the promise of payment, you were willing to protect Carmen… and everyone else in her laboratory.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I ain’t exactly a charity worker, y’know.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How could you do it, then? How did you bring yourself to help them unconditionally when you had nothing to gain from it?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: Is that supposed to be some kind of taunt, or are you actually curious?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I thought your behavior was pathetic at first. You had the power to earn anything for which everyone strove, so I wondered why you would bother taking the path no one else would.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was looking at the matter in a simple way. You would take nothing in the end.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But then I began to think that maybe my lack of knowledge is hindering my assessment of you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I thought my impression of you might change if I heard answers from you directly.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: You think I’m getting the short end of the stick, huh?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I do. At least the other researchers could earn money and honor; what will you have gained?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Can you keep doing what you’re doing even if your efforts are unrewarded, or a bitter end awaits? Even if…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Disregard that. Anyhow, is your job truly worth it?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: The tangible rewards you talked about, like money… Nah, I don’t expect any of that.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: There’s only one thing I’m looking forward to at the end of it all: Carmen’s purpose coming to fruition. I’m pretty sure everybody in the team’s thinking the same thing.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I won’t resent them if I suffered something awful or even died in that process.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: At worst, I’d blame myself for being incapable.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: The reason I can do this, and become more stalwart for every day that passes, is…

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: …I guess you wouldn’t understand even if I told you. ‘Cause you never saw it.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: The strength in her eyes and voice.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose that’s enough. Thank you for your answers.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ll explain the rules as a matter of form.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The book containing the method of extracting Cogito lies beyond that door.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To earn that book, you’ll have to fight with your life on the line.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you die, you’ll become a book yourself. And if you survive, you can return to your friends with the book in hand.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Well? Do you agree to the terms?

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: You aren’t giving it away for free, huh…

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I’m all for this kind of measure, actually. Doesn’t leave any further trouble.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I agree. So open up that door.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re trusting me more easily than I thought.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I don’t have the time to tell shit from shoe polish.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: I wanna be of help to them as soon as I can.

Dialog.Title: The Red Mist
Dialog.Content: If it turns out to be a lie, though, you’re going down with this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Good, I like your composure. I was expecting you to be a bit more rampageous.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then, Kali… May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That big red sword and the clothes the Red Mist was wielding were E.G.O, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As far as I know, the crimson sword was a prototype E.G.O that was luckily extracted.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It could only be created through someone’s gruesome death. Only Kali could wield it properly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And her coat?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s the Red Mist’s own E.G.O, manifested from Kali herself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh… If that’s how powerful manifested E.G.O is, that might flip over the whole food chain of the City.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You probably should’ve realized by now, but not all E.G.O have equal amounts of strength.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Rather, it’d be more accurate to say that few people can draw as much power from E.G.O as Kali could.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In terms of purity alone, the sword she used to wield was of noticeably low quality, considering it was a prototype.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Damn, that was supposed to be low quality…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So, do you get the picture now? About the whole relationship between the Distortion, E.G.O, and Abnormalities?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. I’m finally starting to see it clearly.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Originally, the light that radiated during the event known as the ‘White Nights and Dark Days’ should have shone over the City for seven days straight, not three.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Had that happened, every person in the City would’ve been able to manifest their own E.G.O, giving them the strength to avoid meaningless deaths regardless of wealth or social status.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They would’ve earned the power to challenge the world.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It may have been possible for some to lose the E.G.O they manifested, but no one would have been taken over by their own E.G.O and become Abnormalities.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Then, the Distortion is…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The plan was throttled because of me, which is why the Light could only radiate for three days.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: An unstable power was spread as a result, incubating other possibilities.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Abnormalities manifested through the Distortion are selves that have lost control…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They were consumed by their own E.G.O, so to speak.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: After all, there’s a fine line between E.G.O and Abnormality.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …What’s the prerequisite for these phenomena, E.G.O and Distortion?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Only those who strive to accomplish what they sincerely desire, unbound by any obstacles, will be able to manifest and wield the power.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: However, if the endeavor ends in frustration, or is faced with such despair that one’s ego is shaken and their emotions twisted to an unbearable degree, the Distortion seems to arise from the overwhelmed self.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The stronger and purer the desire is, the greater the Distortion becomes. That’s my speculation so far.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Something doesn’t line up. There’s got to be tons of folks in this City who give up their dreams and fall to despair.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If what you’re saying is correct, the City should be crowded with Abnormalities and E.G.O-bearers by now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Didn’t I make it clear?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It only manifests for those who pursue their own, sincere desires.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …That makes more sense.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s next to no one in the City who dreams for themselves…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Most live with a conformist mindset of just avoiding misfortune in their lives, rather than chasing after their own happiness.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Be it Wings, Syndicates, or Fixers… People are all headed to a destination they probably didn’t set themselves.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The power will only be granted to selfish beings who live strictly for their own good.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Egoists, as some may say…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Well, I like this outcome better than having unworthy scum gain power they don’t deserve.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …So you sabotaged the plan knowing that would happen?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No way. I simply didn’t want to die. I wanted to live; I wanted to take my revenge.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s all there was to it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was meant to be shut down at the end of the plan.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It galled me so much. So I stole the Light and embraced it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Because the light I’d taken for myself wasn’t quite whole, I got myself trapped in this Library I created—along with the Abnormalities, funnily enough.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The orders ingrained into my robotic body have disallowed me from leaving here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If that’s the case, you’ve been collecting books using the Invitation for…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It is to retrieve the Light that was scattered across the City.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You likely must’ve noticed how something’s different about the guests that have come here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: True. They had dreams of some sort, unlike the City folk I’ve known…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They were kinda easily carried away by affection or friendship, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s because they were influenced by the Light. Strongly, at that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You mean they were closer to the pillar of light?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not quite. The same seed of Light was planted in the heart of every person, but some have greater potential to grow it to be more powerful than others.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And the Invitation has been calling them over here at the moment we need them the most.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As we scrape together the incomplete fragments of the Light, I look forward to obtaining a book at the end of the road guided by the Invitation…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The one book holding the power of the complete, undivided Light. It’ll be the book that will give freedom to me and all the librarians that reside here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’ll let me live as a human.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I won’t have to bear with others dictating me to behave as a machine anymore…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I will be able to forget things I want to erase from my memory…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess you’re not feeling any kind of responsibility or guilt for what you’ve done and are doing to try and reach that goal.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Of course not. I have to seize everything with my own hands; I can’t expect anyone else to do it for me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m going to cherish what is mine and only mine as I live my life.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …It’s precisely as you said before, Roland. Everyone has their share of personal affairs and woes. The bereaved have no one but themselves to blame.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Solely for yourself, huh…

Place.PlaceName: Location: R Corp - Fourth Pack Conference Room

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Ey, Rudolph! What’re you gonna do about my Rabbits you borrowed? You didn’t even bring any results!

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry I couldn’t get anything done with those faulty troopers.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: …What the fuck did you just say, you one-horned reindeer?

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: …Oh, I’m sorry your weakass Rabbits were too feeble to get anything done.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: My money’s on you, bunny. Go snap his other antler like a twig!

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Shut up and sit down before I kick all of your arses.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: What’s up, granny. Being serious all of a sudden.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: The Fourth Pack will be dispatched to Nest L and the Library.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The hell? The Library I understand, but the whole Nest?

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The Thumb is shaking after losing an Underboss, so driving them out shouldn’t be difficult at all…

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: It looks like the Index is being a pain in the ass instead. We won’t mobilize many troops; only a few will be going there as reinforcements.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: And what does that have to do with us?

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Our destination is the Library.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: If we fail this mission, all fifteen thousand animals of the Pack—including myself—will be culled.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Haven’t the higher ups bailed us out considering the circumstances?

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: I guess it’s obvious that we’d get in, since the Fourth Pack was organized exclusively for L Corp’s Nest…

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Well… It’s a miracle that we were kept alive for so long considering how awkward our situation’s been.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: We worked our asses off to ensure safety… but our necks are back on the chopping block.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Why do we always have to eat shit.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: L Corp. probably just self-destructed. Why do we have to get ourselves involved in the thick of it?

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Trust is vital for R Corp.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: It would not matter if L Corp. did collapse on its own, but if it turns out to be the work of an outside force, the responsibility would lie on R Corp. for failing to prevent the threat as contracted.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The livestock that didn’t do their job right are to be destroyed…

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: And this task concerns more than just L Corp.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The hell are you talking about now?

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: The Library is also holding a mortgage on W Corp’s Singularity. The books of the corporation’s cleanup crew and passengers that were on one of its trains are apparently under the Library’s possession.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Passengers?

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Myo, did you get contact regarding the task you said you’d handle on your own?

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Myo.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Nope. Hasn’t called me back since.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Damn, that means…

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: She probably used it recklessly after waiting several hours on the train, trying to escape. She’s definitely the kind of person to do it.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: Was there a particular reason you had her take that WARP train?

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Eh, not really… I happened to have some other job I wanted her to do someplace else, so I asked her to take care of that as well.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The Library was only a measly Urban Legend back then, so I didn’t think it’d be a big deal.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: She wasn’t someone who’d die to an Urban Legend, so I gave her that job for sweet bucks, nothing more.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Wait a minute. So she took an economy class seat, not first class?

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Do I look like I’ve got the dosh to pony up a first class ticket, let alone three?

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Aight, let’s say that she somehow got outta the train while it was running and got turned into a book in the Library.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: W Corp. is on the move just to cover up a few regular passengers disappearing?

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: I mean, the train arrived at its destination without any problems people could see.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Yeah. No one would believe the story of the train stopping for that long.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: I wonder why they’d send the cleanup agents in such a hurry~ That could easily backfire and expose its Singularity to the whole world.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Some will be interested in pursuing the truth behind the trains based on the contents of the books, too.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: It’d make more sense if first class passengers were gone as well.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: We have more important matters at hand.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: It’s our job to protect the Singularities and Nests of L Corp, W Corp, and T Corp.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: If we don’t want to be stamped out, we’ll have to retrieve the books related to the Singularity by any means.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: We also need to find out the reason L Corp. collapsed.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: However, if there is falsehood mixed in the evidence you bring, the Ravens will directly dispose of you; be mindful of that.

Dialog.Title: Rhino Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: It’d better have been L Corp. cutting its own throat…

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: It’s silly how everyone acts like their lives depend on the Singularities.

Dialog.Title: Reindeer Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: That’s our job, so we have to secure them with our lives, silly or not.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Hah, right. Y’know, isn’t it still funny? The deal with Singularities, I mean.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: The “time-saving” teleportation of W Corp!

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Which is in fact taking passengers on a thousand-year ride in another dimension, then going through the weird time tunnel thingy or some shit.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: And when the train arrives, those passengers are restored as good as new.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: And T Corp. repackages that time collected by the trains for sale or use, doesn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: I bet some of those passengers are out there enjoying meat stew somewhere in the City, completely oblivious to the hundreds of years of suffering they went through that’s now being used for the pot of humble meat n’ broth they’re eating.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Hell, R Corp’s no different, look at what we…

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: That’s enough.

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: If you rattle off another word about Singularities, I’ll put you in solitary confinement.

Dialog.Title: Rabbit Team Leader - 4th Pack of R Corp.
Dialog.Content: Yem…

Dialog.Title: R Corp. 4th Pack Captain
Dialog.Content: There’s not a moment to lose, so prepare to mobilize.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy… R Corp. is really coming?!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m curious. I wonder how the Library in its state will fare against R Corp.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh really, ma’am! Spoken like someone who never does field work herself…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I trust you to handle it nicely as you always have, even though you’re complaining right now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As much as I’d like to give you advice… The Rabbit Team is the only one I’ve seen in action, so there’s not much I can say here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Eh, don’t sweat it. It’s not like you ever told me how to fight.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Sorry about that.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …C’mon, don’t give me that stern face. I was just joking.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: By the way, why did your corporation hire R Corp?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I could see why at first since I knew nothing about how things went in L Corp, but looking at Gebura and the librarians here, they seemed more than capable of handling any kind of situation.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Things would often go out of control because of the entities we called Abnormalities.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sometimes, the situation became too much of a burden for the employees to handle.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So you called the Rabbit Team to reduce casualties.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Why not the other teams, though?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even though I never saw them myself, I was told in brief when the contract was first made.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
